data: CARD STEMI - Medical Management (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Please ensure that one of the Cardiology Admission order sets is ordered prior to proceeding
Ensure an evaluation of LV function is acquired prior to discharge
Medications
Ensure patient has received a total dose of ASA 160 mg in the past 12 hours
Loading dose
ASA chewable
160 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab-chew, first dose: STAT
ASA chewable
80 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab-chew, first dose: STAT
Maintenance dose
ASA EC
81 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-EC
Loading dose
Clopidogrel loading dose is not required if patient has received clopidogrel for past 7 consecutive days
clopidogrel
300 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
Maintenance dose
clopidogrel
75 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
clopidogrel
75 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
No anticoagulants needed if patient has a known bleeding disorder, or has a history of bleeding
Communication Order
No anticoagulation preferred, patient has a known bleeding disorder
Communication Order
No anticoagulation preferred, patient has a history of bleeding
Select only one anticoagulant, enoxaparin, heparin or fondaparinux
Enoxaparin is CONTRAINDICATED in a patient with a known eGFR of less than 30 mL/min or with suspected severe renal insufficiency
Use with caution and omit IV bolus if age greater then 75 years
enoxaparin
1 mg/kg, subcutaneous, q12h, order duration: 8 day, drug form: inj
Heparin Infusion Lower Target
Use Heparin Infusion Low PTT Target (Module) for heparin orders

Fondaparinux is:  - INDICATED for the medical management of STEMI patient who is not a candidate for PCI  - CONTRAINDICATED if the eGFR is less than 30 mL/min or if the patient has suspected severe renal insufficiency
fondaparinux
2.5 mg, subcutaneous, qPM, order duration: 8 day, drug form: syringe-inj

AVOID nitroglycerin if any of the following are present:   - SBP below 90 mmHg or if more than 30 mmHg drop from baseline  - Suspected right ventricular infarction  - Recent use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors: within 24 hours for sildenafil [VIAGRA] and vardenafil [LEVITRA] and within 48 hours for tadalafil [CIALIS)
nitroglycerin 0.4 mg/spray spray
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, PRN pain-chest, drug form: spray
nitroglycerin titratable infusion (0.2 mg/mL) in D5W standard
Titrate, IV, 10 mcg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/min minimum rate, 200 mcg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 10 mcg/min, q5min PRN for symptoms of ischemia; maintain SPB above 90 mmHg
